summary: Professional website for Casa Di Vida Interior Decoration and Designs showcasing services, portfolio, and client inquiry functionality
architectural_notes: Website type: Professional interior design showcase and inquiry platform
Target aesthetic: Sophisticated, high-end luxury interior design presentation
Backend requirement: Contact form submission storage with timestamps
Portfolio gallery structure: 4 separate tabs/categories (Home, Commercial, Office, Hotels)
Portfolio content requirement: 30 images per section with titles and descriptions (120 total images)
Portfolio categories require distinct visual themes: Home (residential), Commercial (retail/restaurants), Office (corporate), Hotels (hospitality)
known_issues: Portfolio gallery images showing broken image icons - path references need correction

existing_features.title: Create a hero section featuring the company name 'Casa Di Vida Interior Decoration and Designs', a compelling tagline about luxury interior design, and a prominent call-to-action button that scrolls to the contact section

Build a services section showcasing four core interior decoration offerings: space planning, color consultation, furniture selection, and full room design. Each service should have a title, description, and visual representation

Create a portfolio gallery displaying completed interior design projects with at least 30 high-quality images per gallery section. Each project should include an image and description of the design work
Build an about section that introduces Casa Di Vida's design philosophy and company approach to interior decoration, emphasizing their commitment to creating beautiful, functional living spaces
Create a contact form with fields for name, email, phone number, project type (dropdown or radio buttons), and message textarea. Form should include client-side validation
Connect frontend contact form to backend submitContact method using React Query. On successful submission, display a success message and clear the form
Add a fixed or sticky navigation menu with links to all major sections: Home, Services, Portfolio, About, and Contact. Navigation should support smooth scrolling to each section

Apply a sophisticated, elegant visual design system throughout the website using warm color palette (earth tones, creams, golds), professional typography with serif and sans-serif combinations, and high-end aesthetic befitting luxury interior design

Replace the portfolio gallery component to display four separate tab categories: Home, Commercial, Office, and Hotels. Each category should be selectable via tabs and display its own set of project images with titles and descriptions in a dialog-based lightbox interface

Render all generated portfolio images from frontend/public/assets/generated directory. Display 30 images per category (Home, Commercial, Office, Hotels) for a total of 120 portfolio images. Each image must display with its title and detailed description when viewed in the lightbox

Fix the PortfolioGallery component to correctly reference portfolio images from the frontend/public/assets/generated directory, ensuring all 120 images (30 per category: Home, Commercial, Office, Hotels) display properly without broken image icons

Verify that the portfolio image filenames in the component match the exact generated filenames in frontend/public/assets/generated, using proper public asset paths (e.g., /assets/generated/filename.png) instead of relative imports

Update the PortfolioGallery component to reference 120 new unique portfolio images organized by category: 30 Home images (home-1.png through home-30.png), 30 Commercial images (commercial-1.png through commercial-30.png), 30 Office images (office-1.png through office-30.png), and 30 Hotels images (hotels-1.png through hotels-30.png). Each image entry must include a unique title and detailed description appropriate to its category theme.
Verify that the portfolio image filenames in the PortfolioGallery component match the exact generated filenames using proper public asset paths instead of relative imports
Render all 120 generated portfolio images from frontend/public/assets/generated directory in the PortfolioGallery component with proper titles and descriptions for each category

Update the PortfolioGallery component to use a responsive grid layout for displaying portfolio images. The grid should adapt to different screen sizes (e.g., 1 column on mobile, 2-3 columns on tablet, 3-4 columns on desktop) with consistent spacing between images.

Fix the broken image icons in the PortfolioGallery component by correcting the image path references. Ensure all 120 portfolio images (30 per category: home-1.png through home-30.png, commercial-1.png through commercial-30.png, office-1.png through office-30.png, hotels-1.png through hotels-30.png) load correctly from the /assets/generated/ directory using proper public asset paths.
